CatDescriptText: Alexander Fahle, 1803 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that there would be less. I believe that the father would be more successful in regulating the children in such things as when they should be home and when they should study."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alexander Fahle, wearing dark double breasted coat, dark striped necktie, and dark fedora, standing in front of multicolor tiled wall and storefront window displaying shoes
